Page.Name: Fiscal
Page.Title: 1. Fiscal
Page.Description: Fiscal tables offer aggregates and numbers of payers and beneficiaries for default EUROMOD variables/income lists for the whole population. They can also offer aggregates for variables/formulas defined by the user, for the whole population and subgroups of it. For more details on the parameters used for each table check the "Parameter settings" tab.

Table.Description:
The Table shows, on an annual base, aggregate original income, government revenue and government expenditure (using weights). In addition, the last row displays the net budgetary effect, i.e. the change of a scenario's government budget (revenue minus expenditure) with respect to the reference scenario (baseline or previous scenario, as defined by the user).

The following aggregates are displayed:

  1. Total earnings (ils_earns)
  2. Other original income (ils_origy - ils_earns)
  3. Total taxes (ils_tax)
  4. Total SIC (ils_sicdy + ils_sicer)
  5. Total pensions (ils_pen)
  6. Total means tested benefits (ils_benmt)
  7. Total non-means tested benefits (ils_bennt)
  8. Net budgetary effect (taxes + SSC - pensions - benefits)

Moreover, each aggregate, except for b and h, is decomposed into the single variables that build the respective income lists. This decomposition is omitted if no such information is available (e.g. if the country or system could not be identified in the EUROMOD project) or if more than one country is analysed.
Table.Name: RevenueExpenditure
Table.Title: Table 1.1.

Row.Name: RevenueExpenditure_ils_sicdy
Row.Title: Total employees, self-employed and other SIC (ils_sicdy)

Row.Name: RevenueExpenditure_NetEffect
Row.Title: Net budgetary effect (taxes + SIC - pensions - benefits)
Row.Tooltip: ils_tax + ils_sicdy + ils_sicer + ils_sicct - ils_pen - ils_benmt - ils_bennt

Table.Description: The Table shows the total (weighted) number of units receiving/paying incomes, benefits or taxes, for the same breakdown used in Table 1.1. The level of analysis and the criterion used to identify payers/beneficiaries can be checked in the "Parameter settings" tab.
Table.Name: FiscalTaxpayersBeneficiaries
Table.Title: Table 1.2.

Table.Description: The Table shows aggregate weighted values of user-defined variables/formulas on an annual base. The variables/formulas used are shown in the table and in the "Parameter settings" tab. The target population used can be checked in the "Parameter settings" tab.
Table.Name: DisaggregatedConcepts
Table.Title: Table 1.3.

Table.Description: The Table shows total (weighted) numbers of units that fulfil a condition with respect to a specific variable/formula. The variables/formulas used are shown in the table and in the "Parameter settings tab". The level of analysis, the target population and the criterion used to identify payers/beneficiaries can be checked in the "Parameter settings" tab.
Table.Name: DisaggregatedConceptsUnits
Table.Title: Table 1.4.

Page.Description: Distributional tables show results for the whole population, as well as broken down over population groups. For more details on the parameters used for each table check the "Parameter settings" tab.
Page.Name: Distributional
Page.Title: 2. Distributional

Table.Description: The Table shows number and share of units that fulfil a condition with respect to a variable/formula. The variables/formulas used are shown in the table and in the "Parameter settings" tab. The level of analysis, the breakdown variable, the target population and the criterion used to identify payers/beneficiaries can be checked in the "Parameter settings" tab.
Table.Name: DistributionalTaxpayersBeneficiaries
Table.Title: Table 2.1.

Table.Description: The Table shows the annual total of a variable/formula, using weights. The variables/formulas used are shown in the table and in the "Parameter settings" tab. The level of analysis, the breakdown variable and the target population used can be checked in the "Parameter settings" tab.
Table.Name: TotalTaxOrBenefit
Table.Title: Table 2.2.

Table.Name: MeanTaxOrBenefit
Table.Title: Table 2.3.
Table.Description: The Table shows the annual mean of a variable/formula, using weights. The variables/formulas used are shown in the table and in the "Parameter settings" tab. The unit of analysis, the breakdown variable and the target population used can be checked in the "Parameter settings" tab.

Table.Name: AverageTaxBurden
Table.Title: Table 2.4.
Table.Description: The Table shows the quotient of the weighted sum of a variable/formula (typically a tax liability) over the weighted sum of a variable/formula (typically a tax base). The variables/formulas used are shown in the table and in the "Parameter settings" tab. The unit of analysis, the breakdown variable and the target population used can be checked in the "Parameter settings" tab.

Table.Name: MeanDisposableIncome
Table.Title: Table 2.5.
Table.Description: The Table shows the annual mean of (non-equivalised) disposable income (income list ils_dispy), using weights. The unit of analysis, the breakdown variable and the target population used can be checked in the "Parameter settings" tab.

Table.Name: MeanEqDispIncome
Table.Title: Table 2.6.
Table.Description: The Table shows the annual mean of equivalised disposable income on individual level, using weights. Disposable income is defined by the income list ils_dispy and equivalised using the modified OECD equivalence scale. The breakdown variable and the target population used can be checked in the "Parameter settings" tab.

Table.Name: Winners
Table.Title: Table 2.7.
Table.Description: The Tables show number and share of units whose equivalised disposable income increases or decreases in relation to the reference scenario (baseline or previous scenario, as selected by the user). The degree of sensitivity, the level of analysis, the breakdown variable and the target population used can be checked in the "Parameter settings" tab.

Table.Name: Losers
Table.Title: Table 2.8.
Table.Description: The Tables show number and share of units whose equivalised disposable income increases or decreases in relation to the reference scenario (baseline or previous scenario, as selected by the user). The degree of sensitivity, the level of analysis, the breakdown variable and the target population used can be checked in the "Parameter settings" tab.

Page.Name: InequalityAndPoverty
Page.Title: 3. Inequality and Poverty
Page.Description: Inequality and poverty tables show a collection of indicators that measure inequality, progressivity, redistribution and poverty. For more details on the parameters used for each table check the "Parameter settings" tab.

Table.Name: Inequality
Table.Title: Table 3.1.
Table.Description:
The Table shows the following indices:

  1. Gini coefficients for a list of income definitions
  2. Redistribution index
  3. Social welfare index
  4. Income quantile share ratio
  5. Inter-decile ratio
  6. Atkinson inequality index
  7. Mean log deviation

Note that negative incomes are recoded to zeros for the calculations of (a), (b) and (c), to keep consistency with the Statistics Presenter. The variables used to compute (a), (b) and (c) are shown in the table. The formulas used to compute those variables, along with the parameters chosen for (d), (e) and (f), can be checked in the "Parameter settings" tab.

Note also that all the indicators are calculated within each scenario, with no connection to the other scenarios. This means, for example, that the income quantiles of (d) are computed independently for each scenario and do not necessarily include the same observations as the baseline or other reform scenarios.

Row.Name: RedistributionIndex
Row.Title: Redistribution index = Gini A - Gini D

Row.Name: SocialWelfareIndex
Row.Title: Social welfare index = mean eq. disp. income * (1-D)

Table.Name: Progressivity
Table.Title: Table 3.2.
Table.Description:
The Table shows the following indices:

  1. A = Gini gross income
  2. B = Gini net income
  3. C = Kakwani index
  4. D = Net average tax rate
  5. E = Re-ranking effect
  6. A - B = C*D - E = Reynolds-Smolensky index

Note that negative incomes are not recoded to zeros, in order to keep consistency of the decomposition of the redistributive effect. The variables/formulas used to define gross and net income are shown in the table and in the "Parameter settings" tab.

Row.Name: ReynoldsSmolenskyIndex
Row.Title: A - B = C*D - E = Reynolds-Smolensky index

Table.Name: AROPRates
Table.Title: Table 3.3.
Table.Description: The Table shows at-risk-of-poverty rates for a list of income definitions and poverty lines. Income definitions are shown in the table. The formulas used to compute those variables, along with the poverty lines chosen, can be checked in the "Parameter settings" tab.

Table.Name: AROPGap
Table.Title: Table 3.4.
Table.Description: The Table shows at-risk-of-poverty gaps for a list of income definitions and poverty lines. Income definitions are shown in the table. The formulas used to compute those variables, along with the poverty lines and the methodology chosen to calculate the AROP gap, can be checked in the "Parameter settings" tab.

Table.Name: AROPRatesByType
Table.Title: Table 3.5.
Table.Description: The Table shows at-risk-of-poverty rates for equivalised disposable income and a specific poverty line for different population subgroups. The breakdown variable and the poverty line used can be checked in the "Parameter settings" tab.

Table.Name: AROPGapByType
Table.Title: Table 3.6.
Table.Description: The Table shows at-risk-of-poverty gaps for equivalised disposable income and a specific poverty line for different population subgroups. The breakdown variable and the poverty line, along with the methodology chosen to calculate the AROP gap, can be checked in the "Parameter settings" tab.
